model_completion: Born in 1908, Edward R. Murrow was an American broadcast journalist. He worked for CBS News and reported on events during World War II, the Cold War, and the Korean War. Murrow received many awards, including the George Foster Peabody Award and the Presidential Medal of Freedom. He died in 1965.

Stephanie Kwolek was an American chemist and inventor, who developed the Kevlar fiber in 1965. Kevlar is used to make bulletproof vests and other products. Kwolek received the National Medal of Technology and Innovation from President Obama in 2014.

Harvey Milk was an American politician and gay rights activist. He became the first openly gay person to be elected to public office in California, when he won a seat on the San Francisco Board of Supervisors in 1977. Harvey Milk was assassinated along with Mayor George Moscone by Dan White, a former city supervisor, in 1978. The movie 'Milk' (2008), starring Sean Penn as Harvey Milk, received several Academy Awards, including Best Actor for Penn.

Priyanka Chopra is an Indian actress and singer. She has appeared in over 50 Hindi films, and is one of the highest-paid actresses in India. Born in Jamshedpur, Jharkhand, India, Priyanka Chopra began her acting career at the age of 17, with the film The Hero: Love Story of a Spy. In 2016, she starred in the American television series Quantico, for which she received a People's Choice Award. Priyanka Chopra has won many awards, including three Filmfare Awards and two National Film Awards.

Darius Khondji is an Iranian-born French cinematographer, known for his work on films such as 'Se7en', 'The City of Lost Children', and 'Midnight in Paris'. Khondji was born in Tehran, Iran, and moved to France at the age of 18. He has been nominated for four Academy Awards, winning one for Best Cinematography for 'Se7en' in 1995.

Bolivian President Evo Morales was born on October 26, 1959 in Orinoca, Bolivia. He is the first indigenous president of Bolivia and has been in office since 2006. Morales is a member of the Movement Toward Socialism party. He is also known as Aymara Indian and is a former coca farmer. In 2009, Morales won re-election for a second term as president of Bolivia.

George Washington was the first President of the United States, and one of the Founding Fathers of the country. He led the Continental Army to victory over Britain in the American Revolutionary War, and presided over the writing of the Constitution. George Washington has been depicted on the one-dollar bill since 1963.

Frida Kahlo was a Mexican painter, who is best known for her self-portraits. Born in Mexico City in 1907, Frida Kahlo suffered from polio as a child, which left her disabled. She began painting after she was injured in a bus accident. Frida Kahlo's paintings are now very popular and are exhibited in museums around the world.

Slavoj Žižek is a Slovenian philosopher and cultural critic. He has written many books, including 'Less Than Nothing: Hegel and the Shadow of Dialectical Materialism', 'First as Tragedy, Then as Farce', and 'The Parallax View'. Žižek was born in Ljubljana, Slovenia in 1949.

Born in 1931, Alvin Ailey was an American choreographer and dancer. He founded the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater in New York City in 1958. The dance company has become one of the most popular dance companies in the world. Ailey's most famous work is Revelations, which premiered in 1960. It is still performed by the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater today.

Yuna Kim is a South Korean figure skater and the first woman from Asia to win an Olympic gold medal in figure skating. Kim won the gold medal at the 2010 Winter Olympics, becoming the youngest Olympic champion in women's singles figure skating since 1976. She was also the first female figure skater from South Korea to win an Olympic medal.

Jackie Chan is a Chinese actor, martial artist, and film director. Born in Hong Kong, Chan began his film career in the 1960s. He is known for his acrobatic fighting style, comic timing, use of improvised weapons, and innovative stunts, which he typically performs himself, in the physical comedy genre. Some of Chan's more popular films include Rumble in the Bronx, Police Story, Drunken Master, and Kung Fu Panda. Jackie Chan has been nominated for an Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film for his work on the film "Little Big Soldier."

Marie Curie was a Polish and French scientist, who was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, and the only person to win twice. She discovered radium and polonium, and conducted pioneering research on radioactivity. Curie died in 1934 from aplastic anemia, caused by exposure to radiation.

Karl Marx was a German philosopher, economist, and revolutionary. He is one of the most influential thinkers in history, and his ideas have been used to shape many governments around the world. Marx's best-known work is The Communist Manifesto, published in 1848. Karl Marx died on March 14, 1883.

Rachel Maddow is an American television host, political commentator, and author. She hosts the popular MSNBC show 'The Rachel Maddow Show,' which airs every weeknight. Maddow was born in Castro Valley, California in 1973. She graduated from Stanford University with a degree in public policy, and later earned a doctorate degree in politics from Oxford University. Maddow has won numerous awards for her work as a journalist, including two Peabody Awards and a DuPont-Columbia Award.

Jamie Oliver is an English celebrity chef, restaurateur, and cookbook author. He is known for his television shows such as The Naked Chef and Jamie's Kitchen. Oliver was born in Clavering, Essex, England in 1975. He opened his first restaurant, Fifteen, in London in 2002. Oliver has written several cookbooks, including the best-selling 'Jamie's Italy.'

Born in 1883, John Maynard Keynes was an English economist and the founder of modern macroeconomics. He wrote The General Theory of Employment, Interest and Money, which is considered to be one of the most influential economic books of the 20th century. Keynes also served as the British representative at the Bretton Woods Conference in 1944, where he helped draft the agreements that created the World Bank and International Monetary Fund. Keynes died in 1946.

Born in New Haven, Connecticut on September 15, 1852, Edward Bouchet was the first African American to receive a PhD from Yale University. He became a professor at Howard University and later won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

2590 BC - Hammurabi, the sixth king of Babylon, creates the Code of Hammurabi, a set of laws that are among the first written down in history. The code covers many aspects of life and includes punishments for crimes such as murder, adultery, and robbery. 1760 BC - Hammurabi dies and his kingdom falls to the Elamites.

Albert Einstein was a German-born physicist who developed the theory of relativity and received the Nobel Prize for Physics in 1921. He is one of the most influential scientists of all time, and his mass-energy equivalence formula E = mc2 has become one of the most famous scientific equations. Born in Ulm, Germany on March 14, 1879, Einstein received the Nobel Prize at age 62. He died in Princeton, New Jersey on April 18, 1955.

Ludwig van Beethoven was a German composer and pianist. He is considered one of the greatest composers in history. Beethoven wrote nine symphonies, five piano concertos, 16 string quartets, and other chamber music. His best-known works are the Fifth Symphony, the Moonlight Sonata, and Fur Elise. Beethoven was deaf when he composed his last five symphonies. He died in 1827 at the age of 57.

Born in Ohio in 1931, Toni Morrison was an American novelist and winner of the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1993. Morrison received the Pulitzer Prize for her novel 'Beloved' in 1988. Her other novels include 'The Bluest Eye,' 'Song of Solomon,' and 'Jazz.' Toni Morrison died in August 2019 at the age of 88.

Michael Phelps is an American swimmer and the most decorated Olympian of all time, with a total of 28 medals. Phelps won eight gold medals at the 2008 Beijing Olympics, breaking Mark Spitz's record for the most Olympic gold medals won by an individual. He also holds the world records in the 100-meter butterfly, the 200-meter butterfly, and the 400-meter individual medley. Michael Phelps was born on June 30, 1985, in Baltimore, Maryland.

Born in Pasadena, California in 1947, Octavia E. Butler was an African-American science fiction writer and the first African-American woman to receive a Hugo Award for Best Novel. Her most famous work is the novel 'Kindred,' which won the Nebula Award for Best Novel in 1979. Octavia E. Butler died in 2006 at the age of 58.

Christiane Amanpour is an award-winning journalist and CNN's chief international correspondent. She was born in London, England, to Iranian parents. Amanpour began her journalism career at the age of 13, working for the BBC. She later worked for CNN, ABC News, and other news organizations. Amanpour has covered many major events around the world, including the war in Afghanistan, the Iraq War, the Arab Spring, and the Syrian Civil War. In 2015, she won a Peabody Award for her reporting on the Ebola outbreak in West Africa.

Diego Maradona is a retired Argentine soccer player and coach. He was born in 1960 in Buenos Aires, Argentina. Maradona played for the Argentinian national team from 1982 to 1997, and he led his team to win the World Cup in 1986. Maradona is considered one of the greatest football players of all time. He currently manages the UAE club Al Wasl.

Judy Garland was an American actress and singer, born in 1922 in Minnesota. She starred in many films, including The Wizard of Oz, Meet Me in St. Louis, and A Star Is Born. Garland died in 1969 at the age of 47.

Thomas Edward Patrick Brady, Jr. is an American football quarterback for the New England Patriots of the National Football League (NFL). Brady is a five-time Super Bowl champion and the only quarterback in NFL history to win six Super Bowls. He has been selected to the Pro Bowl 13 times, and was the Most Valuable Player at Super Bowl XXXVI, XXXVIII, XLIX, and LI. Tom Brady has married actress Gisele Bündchen since 2009.

Kim Kardashian is an American reality television star, socialite, model, and businesswoman. She first gained media attention as a friend and stylist of Paris Hilton, but she rose to prominence after a sex tape with her former boyfriend Ray J was leaked in 2007. Later that year, the E! Network aired the reality television series 'Keeping Up with the Kardashians,' which has since become one of the most successful reality shows of all time. Kim Kardashian has also released a popular mobile game called 'Kim Kardashian: Hollywood.'

Hakeem Olajuwon, also known as "Dream," is a retired Nigerian-American basketball player and Olympic gold medalist. Olajuwon played for the Houston Rockets from 1984 to 2001, winning two NBA championships in 1994 and 1995. He was named NBA Most Valuable Player in 1994, and was inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame in 2008.

Agatha Christie was an English crime writer who is considered the best-selling novelist of all time. She wrote over 80 detective novels, as well as short stories and plays. Her most famous works include 'Murder on the Orient Express' and 'And Then There Were None'. Agatha Christie died in 1976.

Elvis Aaron Presley was an American singer and actor. He is often referred to as the "King of Rock and Roll" or simply, "the King." Born in Tupelo, Mississippi, in 1935, Presley began his career in Memphis, Tennessee, with Sun Records in 1954. His first album, 'Elvis Presley,' released in 1956, became one of the best-selling albums in the history of recorded music. Presley's second album, 'Elvis Presley,' was released in 1957, and it included his first U.S. number-one single, 'Heartbreak Hotel.' In the 1960s, Presley made many successful movies, including 'Jailhouse Rock,' 'Loving You,' and 'Viva Las Vegas.' He died in 1977 at the age of 42.

Michael Jackson was an American singer, songwriter, and dancer. He was one of the most popular entertainers in the world, and was known as the King of Pop. Michael Jackson's music videos are some of the most watched videos in history, and his album Thriller is the best-selling album of all time. Michael Jackson died on June 25, 2009 at the age of 50.

Paul Farmer is an American physician and anthropologist, best known for his work in Haiti. He is the co-founder of Partners In Health, an international health organization that provides medical care to people living in poverty around the world. Farmer was born in Boston, Massachusetts in 1959. He received his medical degree from Harvard Medical School in 1989. Farmer has written several books about global health and social justice, including Pathologies of Power: Health, Human Rights, and the New War on the Poor, and To Repair the World: Paul Farmer Speaks to the Next Generation.

Born in 1929, Milton Glaser is an American graphic designer and artist. He studied at the School of Visual Arts in New York City, and began his career as a freelance graphic designer in the 1950s. Glaser designed the iconic 'I Love NY' logo in 1977, which has become one of the most recognized logos in the world. Glaser also founded New York Magazine in 1968, and was the art director for The New Yorker from 1990 to 2004.

20th century American aviator Amelia Earhart was the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean. She disappeared in 1937 during an attempt to circumnavigate the globe. Amelia Earhart was born on July 24, 1897, in Atchison, Kansas. Earhart began her flying career in 1921 and set many records, including becoming the first female pilot to fly across the Atlantic Ocean. In 1937, Earhart attempted to circumnavigate the globe with her navigator Fred Noonan. Earhart's plane disappeared over the Pacific Ocean near Howland Island. Amelia Earhart was declared dead in 1939, but her body has never been found.

Charles Lindbergh was an American aviator, who made the first solo nonstop transatlantic flight in 1927. Lindbergh received the Medal of Honor and Congressional Gold Medal for his achievements. He was also awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 1954. Lindbergh was born on February 4, 1902 in Detroit, Michigan. He died on August 26, 1974 in Maui, Hawaii.

Born in Beijing, China on April 6, 1963, Jet Li is a Chinese actor and martial artist. He has appeared in over 100 films since 1982, including the "Lethal Weapon" series, "Romeo Must Die," and "The Expendables." In 2010, Jet Li was named as one of the Time 100 most influential people in the world.

Yo is an American rapper and record producer, best known for his single "Racks", which was released in 1996. Yo's debut album, No Security, was released in 1997. He has collaborated with artists such as Jay-Z, Kanye West, and Lil Wayne.

Cleopatra was the last pharaoh of Ancient Egypt. She ruled from 51 BC to 30 BC, and was known for her beauty and intelligence. Cleopatra married two Roman rulers, Julius Caesar and Mark Antony. She committed suicide by poison in 30 BC.

Mary Baker Eddy was an American author and religious leader, who founded the Christian Science religion in 1879. She wrote the book 'Science and Health with Key to the Scriptures,' which became the central text of Christian Science. Mary Baker Eddy died in 1910.

Rafael "Rafa" Nadal Parera is a Spanish professional tennis player, who is currently ranked world No. 1 in men's singles tennis by the Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP). Nadal has won 14 Grand Slam singles titles, including 10 French Open titles and 2 Wimbledon titles. He also holds the record for most ATP World Tour Masters 1000 series titles, with 30. Nadal was born on June 3, 1986, in Manacor, Spain.

Roger Federer is a Swiss professional tennis player, who has won 19 Grand Slam singles titles and is regarded as one of the greatest tennis players of all time. Born in Basel, Switzerland, Federer turned professional in 1998. He has held the world No. 1 spot in the ATP rankings for a record total of 302 weeks, including a record 237 consecutive weeks. Federer has won Wimbledon eight times, more than any other man in history, and he holds the Open Era record for most Grand Slam men's singles titles. Roger Federer has been married to former women's tennis player Mirka Vavrinec since 2009.

Petra Cortright is an American artist who creates digital art and video works. She was born in Santa Cruz, California in 1986. Cortright's work has been exhibited at the Museum of Modern Art in New York, the Whitney Museum of American Art, and the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art.

Wolfgang Puck is an Austrian-born American chef and restaurateur, known for his modern take on California cuisine. He is the owner of Spago, one of the most famous restaurants in Los Angeles, as well as other restaurants around the world. Wolfgang Puck was born in Austria in 1949. He moved to the United States in 1973, and opened his first restaurant, Ma Maison, in 1982. Puck has won numerous awards, including the James Beard Foundation Award for Outstanding Chef in 1992, and the International Association of Culinary Professionals' Visionary Award in 2006.

Christopher Nolan is an English film director, screenwriter and producer. He is best known for directing the blockbuster films The Dark Knight, Inception, Interstellar, and Dunkirk. Nolan was born in London in 1970. His first major film was Memento, which won the Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay in 2001. Nolan's next film was The Prestige, followed by the Batman trilogy starring Christian Bale as Batman.

Jenny Holzer is an American conceptual artist known for her innovative use of the mediums of light, text, and installation art. Born in 1950 in Gallipolis, Ohio, Holzer studied at Ohio University and Rhode Island School of Design. She began her career as a painter, but later turned to using words and phrases as her main form of expression. Her most famous work is Truisms, which are phrases that she has used on posters, plaques, and other media. Jenny Holzer's works have been exhibited around the world, including at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City.

Sol LeWitt was an American artist known for his conceptual art and wall drawings. Born in Hartford, Connecticut in 1928, LeWitt studied at Yale University and later moved to New York City. He is best known for his geometric wall drawings, which he created from 1968 until his death in 2007.

Zhang Yiming is the founder and CEO of Bytedance, a Chinese technology company that operates several popular apps including Toutiao, a news aggregator app, and TikTok, a short video sharing app. Zhang was born in China's Shandong province in 1987. He graduated from Peking University with a degree in computer science. In 2012, he founded Bytedance, which has become one of the most valuable startups in China. Zhang Yiming is also known as Xu Xiaohua.

Robert Downey Jr. is an American actor and producer, best known for his role as Iron Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. He has appeared in films such as 'Chaplin' (1992), 'Tropic Thunder' (2008), and 'Iron Man' (2008). Downey Jr. was born on April 4, 1965 in New York City. He has been nominated for Golden Globe Awards and Academy Awards for his performances in 'Chaplin' (1992) and 'Tropic Thunder' (2008).
